title: Feb 1: {N} Advanced Topics in Spoken Language Processing

cells.data:
## Representations of sounds
Single letter may have different acoustic realizations (in _orthographic_ representation). Need a better system to notate the different sounds, since not one-to-one.

_Phonetic symbol sets_: 
_Interantional Phonetic Alphabet_: IPA sets contains hundreds of different symbols, picks out different ones for different languages. A single symbol for every sound accross all sounds of the world's languages.

_ARPAbet, TIMIT, ..._: Ascii but multiple characters for sounds (english only though.)

These don't capture the transitions between different sounds.

## Phones vs. Phonemes vs Allophones
_Phones_: distinct sounds of language whether it convsains meaning or not

_Phonemes_: collection of sounds that convey the same meaning and can change meaning of a waord if exchanged for another phoneme

_consonants_: Restriction/blockage of air flow, and can be voiced or voiceless
_vowels_: Generally voiced
_semivowels_(glides): sort of consonants sort of vowels

Vowels are where the amplitude is highest.
